Event.name: Respond_to_proposal
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> addresses a <fen>Proposal</fen> made by an <fen>Interlocutor</fen>, either agreeing to it or rejecting it. Agreeing entails a social responsibility on the <fen>Speaker</fen> to bring about some state of affairs encoded in the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Interlocutor">They</fex> were <t>rebuffed</t> <fex name="par">again</fex> <fex name="pla">in the larger city of Provo</fex>. <fex name="Speaker">CNI</fex> </ex>
<ex><fex name="Time">Last month</fex> <fex name="Speaker">Mr Duisenberg</fex> <m>delivered</m> a <fex name="Manner">sharp</fex> <t>rebuff</t> <fex name="int">to Mr Welteke</fex>. </ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">He</fex> <t>rebuffed</t> <fex name="Proposal">Singh's every overture</fex>, <fex name="Depict">relentlessly pursuing a cap on India's nuclear capability</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Iran</fex> on Saturday <t>rejected</t> Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Interlocutor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen> can be understood from the context.
<ex>But senior SLN officials had <t>rebuffed</t> <fex name="int">the man who is ever so willing to please the guerrillas</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>As with <fen>Medium</fen> in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by "on" or "in".</def-root>

Arg.name: Proposal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
<ex>Dr. Carolyn Herrington has <t>accepted</t> <fex name="pro">our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Speaker that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>).
<ex>Moreover, as with Surrey, myths have proliferated, such as that Oxford <fex name="Manr">cruelly</fex> <t>rejected</t> his wife in 1576.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
<ex>She <t>turned</t> it <t>down</t>, <fex name="Depict">unaware she would some day become a member</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by the <fen>Speaker</fen> responds to the <fen>Proposal</fen> . <ex>Others, I would say have actually <t>turned</t> me <t>down</t> <fex name="Mns">by not replying and not responding</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Internal_cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, the <fen>Speaker</fen> mental or emotional state.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a verbal response.
<ex>Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been <t>rebuffed</t> repeatedly <fex name="pla">in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
<ex>This must make <fex name="tim">yesterday's</fex> Taliban <t>rebuff</t> all the more wounding.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> intends to accomplish by making a verbal response.
<ex>He was asked to join the National Assembly ruling party, but repeatedly <t>turned</t> them <t>down</t> <fex name="pur">in order to continue his work as a journalist</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of response events. </def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Role</fen> denotes the capacity in which the <fen>Interlocutor</fen> is judged.
<ex>The Policy Committee had <t>rejected</t> her <fex name="rol">as a candidate for chronic dialysis</fex> because of her young age. .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Group
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Group</fen> is the set of people within which the Respond_to_proposal is occuring.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root> The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the success or failure logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the success or failure, but not in all cases.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: turn down.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: reject an offer or application of something or from someone.

lexUnit.name: rebuff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: reject in an abrupt or ungracious manner.

lexUnit.name: reject.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: refuse to consider or agree to

lexUnit.name: accept.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give a favorable response to

lexUnit.name: acceptance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of giving a favorable response

lexUnit.name: rejection.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of refusing a proposal by another

lexUnit.name: refuse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to not accept an offer
